page.title: 05S.W.R.I.
page.content: The S.W.R.I. started in 1917, alternately using Kilmany and Rathillet churches. The 102 members met monthly at full moon as this made walking along unlit roads a lot easier. These people had demonstrations to show them practical everyday skills such as butter-making, baking or knitting. Nowadays demonstrators show only 30 members very different skills such as basket- weaving and flower arranging .Women from the W.R.I. didn't meet in July and August as this was the busy harvest season and they had to help on the farm. The members of the W.R.I. today still don't meet then but they don't have to help as more and more mechanical machines are being used on farms.
